An artificer's notes on Humans

“You'd think it'd be easier to fabricate my own reconstruction of the most common beings on the continent; but Humans have proven to be… unusual, as a species.”

- Xilora Greymantle, Master Artificer of the Sixth Order

  • 5/9/3/9984 - As they are the most populous sapient race on the continent, I will be focusing on Humans as the basis of study for my Project
  • 6/9/3/9984 - One possible complication (or avenue of future research?): Humans are unusual on Aidilon in that they are the only race able to produce viable mixed-blood offspring. All known half races are half human, half something else (orc, elf, devil, etc.)
  • 3/1/4/9984 - I was hoping that learning about their origins would prove useful, but I discovered that they have none… at least not on record. Humans are the only member of the five “ancient races” from pre-history (Humans, Elves, Dwarves, Gnomes, and Halflings) that can't trace their ancestry all the way back to a specific region of the continent. No one knows where they originally came from, but some of the relevant scholars think it may have been the wastelands of Wrakarr, many millennia ago. Seems unlikely.
  • 7/1/4/9984 - Humans are less… common than I had hoped; pivoting to other avenues of research
